Smash: Build Specification

The build specification is separated into two tables for your convenience. The first table lists the build-system specifications and the second table lists the software-system specifications.

The first field in the specification tables are a reference to an external project by it's official project name or official package name. Official project name is preferred, followed by a 'generified/generic' package-name within parenthesis.

The second field of the specification tables are the Dev. Version fields, which refer to the current version of the program being used on the machine of the smash-project-maintainer(s) during the time of the table-data-field-entry.

Finally, the third field of the specification tables are the Notes fields, which provides any extra information that may be beneficial knowledge about the external project.

Build-System

Package Dev. Version Notes
GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 8.2.1 r20180831 (ArchLinux)
GNU Make 4.2.1
GNU Automatic Configuration Tools (autoconf) 2.13 autoconf version 2.13 is a specification of the Mozilla js-1.8.5 build-system.
GNU Bourne Again Shell (BASH) 4.4
BSD Package Configuration (pkgconf alias pkg-config) 1.5.3-1 (ArchLinux: base-devel: pkgconf)

This is a general, rather than complete listing of the build-system specifications.

Software-System

Package Dev. Version Notes
NetScape Portable Runtime (NSPR) 4.20-1 (ArchLinux) Oct, 27 2018
GNU Readline (readline) 7.0.005-1 (ArchLinux)

This is a general, rather than complete listing of the software-system specifications.

Where '(ArchLinux)' is the name of the Linux operating system in use for project compilation, optionally followed by the date the time the record was taken.

Where 'BSD' is a reference to a package of the Berkeley Software Distribrution.

Where 'GNU' is a reference to a package of the GNU Project.
